intro: Rytigynia seyrigii, commonly known as the Brazilian wild coffee, is a small evergreen shrub native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces small, red berries that contain a single seed, and it is adapted to thrive in humid, shaded environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat fragmentation, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
